data.title: Amazing
data.text: This place was wonderful. We walked there from the pier area. It's a quick walk and well worth it. When we walked up there was a small line but it went really fast. We found a seat outside and enjoyed the sunshine a great weather until they brought our food to us. Both dishes were great. Would recommend to anyone looking for some poke!

data.title: Great Poke!
data.text:
We had poke a couple of times on our trip to LA and this was definitely the best. For one, it's rare that you order spicy tuna and it is actually spicy, which was refreshing.

The rice is flavorsome and the set combinations worked for us.

data.title: Perfect Healthy and Fresh Lunch Option!
data.text: Loved the build your own bowl with such a wide variety of fresh and tasty ingredients. It was so good, it made you want to come back every noontime :).  A few notes, all the items were either vegetables or fish (i.e. no meat). The rice isn't dry white rice. All that said, if you're good with that, it was absolutely awesome!

data.title: Just perfect
data.text:
Just perfect. Fresh, Healthy, organic.. what else?
Why we have not the same in France? It would have a huge success.

data.title: Fresh and tasty lunch spot!
data.text: Sweetfin Poke has a great menu with an option to build your own bowl and there are options for the non-fish eaters out there too. All their fish is wild-caught except the salmon and their ingredients are fresh. If you have dietary restrictions (such as gluten-free  or FODMAP), they can accommodate you and they always seem to know what is in each part of the dish if you're custom building. Staff friendliness is improving which is great but it's a relatively quick meal (though lines out the door may slow you down at lunch time) so it's not significant. Great value for freshness and quality!

data.title: quick, fresh, awesome flavor
data.text: Can't wait to go back, was not disappointed.  Cant wait to try other things on the menu.  We had the spicy tuna poke bowl and the vegetable poke bowl both were excellent.

data.title: Amazing!!
data.text: This is an amazing new trendy cuisine. Poke consists of raw salmon, tuna or other fish, a rice/noodle base and a series of very interesting toppings. The trend started from Hawaii and is growing in popularity! The flavors blend amazingly and it's healthy too! Absolutely highly recommend! Slightly pricey for the portions but totally worth every penny!

data.title: Best meal of our trip!
data.text: Loved the food. So good!  I wish we had one of these back in Connecticut. Highly recommend. The bamboo rice is fantastic as is the kelp noodles. The fish was fresh and delicious.

data.title: As delicious as it looks
data.text: There was a line up out the door, but the line moved quickly... DELICIOUS poké bowls with three options for the base (rice, cucumber, or kale) and a number of different fish options. We were five and ordered four different bowls, each equally delicious. My only regret... that I didn't order crispy onions on the top.

data.title: Tasty, fresh poke in nice casual spot, love it!
data.text: The food here is great. They have several bowls on the menu and you can also add or take away from the ingredients or go totally a la carte.  They provide extra sauce and topping for free.The fish is fresh, very tasty, love this place!

data.title: Quick, fresh, and friendly
data.text: Sweeten Poke is consistently great for lunch.  Try to get there after 2 if you can though--the line is also consistently out the door!

data.title: fresh and healthy food but small portions
data.text: fresh and healthy (amazing) food but to small portions, it's a nice concept and a welcomed variety to (great) burger / taco chains. pl offer larger portions to justify the price

data.title: Small, fun, good quality
data.text: The poke bowls here are quite good and you can create your own with various toppings like crisped garlic, cilantro, etc.  The bamboo rice is interesting...it's green.  You can use a base other than rice if you like.  You order at the counter and then pick up.   They have different infused drinks every day... like strawberry lemonade.   Only down side is there is often a line.

data.title: The Best
data.text: We love Sweetfin Poke. Raw fish on delicious bases of salad or rice. We get the basic tuna with a cucumber and noodle salad base that is amazing. They also offer free topings. I get a few sides of seaweed salad on top. They have two sizes-small and large. We've only tried the large and it's the perfect size for dinner. It's become one of our favorites. Only problem is that we live in West LA and it's hard to get to the restaurant in San Monica during rush hour. I wish there was one closer to our house. Don't miss it.

data.title: Locals and all
data.text: Incredibly fresh fast food poke. Duhlicious! Don't worry about the line coming out the door. It moves very fast. About 12 people every 10 minutes, so you can calculate your wait time.mmmmmm

data.title: Good Food.Service Meh.
data.text: I am not the target customer. That would be college age and young professionals. But! I am a foodie and discerning about poke' having worked in Hawaii for many years. The food is good. The price is reasonable for the area. The service is average with the order taker coping quite an attitude and no smile to be seen. Other than that it's a fast, solid food offering with little to no service. Would go back when venturing to LAX. Ate spicy ahi bowl.

data.title: Yummy Poké
data.text: Every time I visit my daughter in LA I have to make a stop here to get my poké fix.  The ingredients are fresh and everything is delicious.  Sweetfin has a good variety of the kinds of bases and add-on's.  It's also nice to have other options besides rice like the kelp noodles or the kale slaw.  Plus they have a tofu base for vegetarians.  The space isn't very big so seating is limited.  But it's always great to get poké on the go too.

data.title: great brunch/lunch
data.text: Super, healthy good value experience. Various seafood/salad/rice combinations available. Slightly funky. Meter parking nearby.

data.title: Delicious poke
data.text: Great concept, cute space. I had the albacore mango combination with macadamia nuts and it was good. It's on the pricey side but it is very good, I will be back.

data.title: I love to poke around!
data.text:
This is a great restaurant that is perfect for the person on the go that wants delicious fresh Poke. It is totally set up with all togo containers that  are used whether you eat in or not. 

Today I enjoyed the spicy tuna bowl creamy togarashi sauce, hijiki, avocado over a bed of rice. It was fantastic with just the right amount of heat, I will order it with less dressing so it doesn't overpower the tuna. I also had the mango albacore, ponzu-lime sauce, macadamia nuts ginger. 
When you hear the combinations of these wonderful ingredients it makes your mouth water! This just rocks the tastebuds! 

The restaurants atmosphere is a bit cold and small but the music and lighting are cool. It's a fast and efficient joint that closes at 9:30. Love it and I'll be back soon to poke around some more.
